Testimony from Sabino: Pio" Renteria, a resident elected to the District 3 seat on the Austin City Council, who stated that fifteen years ago, pizza delivery was not available in the neighborhood.
Confirmation from Zach Rogers: a former pizza delivery driver, who mentioned that his boss required him to deliver pizzas everywhere, including the neighborhood in question, around 1999-2000.
Input from Hoover Alexander: a restaurant owner in East Austin, who shared that the perception of the neighborhood as unsafe and crime-ridden led to a "no delivery zone" until around 2000-2005.
Accounts from Jane and Gilberto Rivera: residents of a neighboring area, who recalled their inability to get a pizza delivery in their neighborhood, indicating a similar situation in the wider East Austin region.
